intro: Saccolabium archytas, commonly known as the narrow-leaf false dandelion, is a perennial herb native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant features basal leaves that are narrow and lance-shaped, with hairy surfaces, and produces yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, wind-dispersed seeds. The plant thrives in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
